title: China offers scholarships to Senegalese students in 2021
description: Within the framework of Sino-Senegalese educational cooperation, the Chinese Government offers the Senegalese Government full scholarships for the academic year 2021/2022 in favor of students of Senegalese nationality in bachelor's, master's or doctorate for all courses offered by Chinese universities qualified to receive scholarship holders.   It does not specify how many scholarships will be available.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
China offers scholarships to Senegalese students in 2021

# Description
Within the framework of Sino-Senegalese educational cooperation, the Chinese Government offers the Senegalese Government full scholarships for the academic year 2021/2022 in favor of students of Senegalese nationality in bachelor's, master's or doctorate for all courses offered by Chinese universities qualified to receive scholarship holders.   It does not specify how many scholarships will be available.
justification: Project focuses on educational scholarships without direct environmental or energy transition implications
evidence: Scholarships for Senegalese students in various academic programs, educational cooperation framework

title: Postal Savings Bank of China provides loan for Belgrade Underground Parking Lot Construction Project
description: On July 3, 2019, China Shandong International Economic and Technical Cooperation Corporation signed an agreement with the city of Belgrade for the construction of public underground garages. Then, on November 9, 2020, China Shandong International Economic and Technical Cooperation Corporation signed a loan agreement with the Jinan Branch of the Postal Savings Branch of China for the Belgrade Underground Parking Lot Construction Project. The project is reportedly the first Chinese public-private partnership (PPP) project in Europe.   China Shandong International Economic and Technical Cooperation Corporation was granted a 40-year concession to manage the parking garages.   Shandong's bid was EUR 5,800,171.31 and a construction time of 570 days. The parking garages are located on Student Square, Republic Square, Fruškogorska Street, and Vlajkovićeva street (Studentskom trgu, Trgu republike, Fruškogorskoj ulici, Vlajkovićevoj ulici in Serbian). There will be about 3,000 parking spaces between the four garages.   The garages have been criticized for being too close to the monument "Building of the National Assembly" and the "Ancient Singidunum" archeological site. The project is also expected to result in the destruction of a park.   The construction of the garage on Vlajkoviceva Street was originally scheduled to begin in September 2021 and a contractor was already selected in 2022 (a Chinese construction company known as Shandong Luqiao). The construction of the other garage -- the one on Fruskogorska Street -- was originally scheduled to begin December 2021. The construction of the garage in Vlajkoviceva Street was originally expected to take 15 months to build and the construction of the one in Fruskogorska Street was originally expected to take 18 months to build.
staff_comments: 1. The Chinese project title is 贝尔格莱德地下停车场项目.2. The precise face value and borrowing terms of the loan are unknown. Multiple sources cite 'around EUR 50 million' as the total amount of investment, but it seems unlikely that the loan was issued in EUR. This issue warrants further investigation. 3. It is unclear when the implementation start date was. Bids for some underground parking garages were announced in September of 2020 (see '塞尔维亚贝尔格莱德市Vlajkoviceva地下停车场项目EPC总承包招标中标候选人公示'). However, China Shandong definitely signed an agreement relating to this project with the Government of the City of Belgrade in June 2019 (see 'Potpisan ugovor o izgradnji četiri podzemne garaže u Beogradu'). It is therefore hard to say when construction actually began. It does not seem to have been completed as of July 2022. 4. A Serbian project name is currently unavailable. The names of the streets are in Serbian in the Latin alphabet, but searching in Cyrillic is usually more effective. 5. The Jinan Branch of the China Postal Savings Bank (中国邮政储蓄银行股份有限公司济南市阳光新路支行因机构名) recently changed its name to Postal Savings Bank of China Co., Ltd. Jinan Shizhong District Sub-branch (中国邮政储蓄银行股份有限公司济南市市中区支行) but sources for this project use the older name.
combined_text:
# Sector
TRANSPORT AND STORAGE

# Title
Postal Savings Bank of China provides loan for Belgrade Underground Parking Lot Construction Project

# Description
On July 3, 2019, China Shandong International Economic and Technical Cooperation Corporation signed an agreement with the city of Belgrade for the construction of public underground garages. Then, on November 9, 2020, China Shandong International Economic and Technical Cooperation Corporation signed a loan agreement with the Jinan Branch of the Postal Savings Branch of China for the Belgrade Underground Parking Lot Construction Project. The project is reportedly the first Chinese public-private partnership (PPP) project in Europe.   China Shandong International Economic and Technical Cooperation Corporation was granted a 40-year concession to manage the parking garages.   Shandong's bid was EUR 5,800,171.31 and a construction time of 570 days. The parking garages are located on Student Square, Republic Square, Fruškogorska Street, and Vlajkovićeva street (Studentskom trgu, Trgu republike, Fruškogorskoj ulici, Vlajkovićevoj ulici in Serbian). There will be about 3,000 parking spaces between the four garages.   The garages have been criticized for being too close to the monument "Building of the National Assembly" and the "Ancient Singidunum" archeological site. The project is also expected to result in the destruction of a park.   The construction of the garage on Vlajkoviceva Street was originally scheduled to begin in September 2021 and a contractor was already selected in 2022 (a Chinese construction company known as Shandong Luqiao). The construction of the other garage -- the one on Fruskogorska Street -- was originally scheduled to begin December 2021. The construction of the garage in Vlajkoviceva Street was originally expected to take 15 months to build and the construction of the one in Fruskogorska Street was originally expected to take 18 months to build.
justification: Project focuses on construction of parking facilities without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Underground parking lot construction, 3000 parking spaces, general infrastructure project

title: China Eximbank provides EUR 134.4 million loan for State Road of 1B Category No. 27 Loznica-Valjevo-Lazarevac, Section Iverak-Lajkovac (Intersection on the Highway E-763 Belgrade-Pozega) Construction Project
description: On November 26, 2021, China Eximbank and the Government of the Republic of Serbia signed an EUR 134,300,000 loan agreement [No. BLA20210340034)] for the State Road of 1B Category No. 27 Loznica-Valjevo-Lazarevac, Section Iverak-Lajkovac (Intersection on the Highway E-763 Belgrade-Pozega) Construction Project.  The loan carries the following borrowing terms: a 15-year maturity, a 4-year grace period, an interest rate of 6-month EURIBOR plus 2.35% margin, a 2% default (penalty) interest rate, a 0.5% commitment fee, a 0.5% (EUR 671,500) management fee, an 7.1% (EUR 9,584,786.19) Sinosure credit insurance premium.  The borrower was expected to use the proceeds of the loan to finance 85% of the cost of a commercial (EPC) contract between China Shandong International Economic and Technical Cooperation Group, Ltd. of Shandong Hi-Speed Group Co. Ltd., the Government of the Republic of Serbia (represented by the Ministry of Construction, Transport and Infrastructure) and the Public Enterprise “Roads of Serbia”, which was signed on June 10, 2020.   The lender made disbursements worth $63,982,000 in 2022. The loan’s (principal) amount outstanding was $0 as of December 31, 2021 and $63,982,000 as of September 31, 2022.   The purpose of the project is to construct a two-way, four lane State Road that passes through Valjevo (Popucke, Lukavac, Divci, Klanica, Loznica and Veselinovac), and Lajkovac (Slovac, Markova Crkva,Ratkovac and Nepricava). The road has a total expected length of 18.3 km, and the maximum allowed speed of 100 km per hour. There are 20 bridges (including 4 large bridges, and 16 medium and small bridges), with a total length of about 2.5 km (among which, 1.83 km for 4 large bridges, and 0.51 km for 16 medium and small bridges).   Construction commenced in June 2020. Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic visited the project site near the town of Klanica on March 23, 2021. The project was originally expected to reach completion by the end of 2022.
staff_comments: 1. AidData has estimated the all-in interest rate by adding 2.35% to average 6-month EURIBOR in November 2021 (-0.534%). 2. The China Eximbank loan agreement can be accessed in its entirety via https://www.dropbox.com/s/fgiparvkv6wos1i/China%20Eximbank%20loan%20agreement%20for%20Construction%20of%20the%20State%20Road%20of%201B%20Category%20No.%2027%20Loznica-Valjevo-Lazarevac%2C%20Section%20Iverak-Lajkovac%20%28Intersection%20on%20the%20Highway%20E-763%20Belgrade-Pozega%29.pdf?dl=03. The Serbian project title is Пројекат изградње државног пута 1.Б реда бр. 27 Лозница – Ваљево – Лазаревац, деоница Иверак – Лајковац (веза са аутопутем Е-763 Београд – Пожега.
combined_text:

title: China Eximbank provides $68 million loan to Serbia Zijin Copper Doo Bor for its working capital needs
description: On August 31, 2018, Zijin Mining Group purchased a 63% ownership stake in Rudarsko-Topioničarski Basen RTB Bor Doo (or ‘RTB Bor’) — a state-owned copper mining and smelting complex located in Bor, Serbia — in a $1.26 billion deal with the Government of Serbia. The agreement was part of the Government of Serbia’s broader efforts to sell-off indebted state-run companies to help spur growth and relieve pressure on the budget, as recommended by the International Monetary Fund (IMF). As part of the agreement, Zijin Mining Group promised to cover RTB Bor’s $200 million debt and keep 5,000 jobs at the mine. Out of the $1.26 billion, Zijin Mining Group said that $135 million would be invested in improving the environment while another $320 million in opening a new copper mine.   Then, in 2021, the Paris Branch of China Eximbank and Serbia Zijin Copper Doo Bor (塞尔维亚紫金铜业) — a special purpose vehicle and joint venture of Zijin Mining Group (63% ownership stake) and Rudarsko-Topioničarski Basen RTB Bor Doo (37% ownership stake) — signed a $68 million term loan facility agreement. The borrowing terms of the loan are unknown. However, it is known that the borrower was expected to use the loan proceeds for its working capital needs. Zijin Mining Group issued a corporate guarantee in support of this loan.
staff_comments: 1. Serbia Zijin Copper Doo Bor was established in 2019 and made responsible for the Mining and Smelting Basin Bor (RTB Bor) for a 30-year period. 2. The Republic of Serbia Development Fund and equity funds of the Serbian government hold a 99.9999894905% equity interest in Rudarsko-Topioničarski Basen RTB Bor Doo, and the other 6 minority shareholders in aggregate hold the remaining 0.0000105095% equity interest.
combined_text:
# Sector
INDUSTRY, MINING, CONSTRUCTION

# Title
China Eximbank provides $68 million loan to Serbia Zijin Copper Doo Bor for its working capital needs

# Description
On August 31, 2018, Zijin Mining Group purchased a 63% ownership stake in Rudarsko-Topioničarski Basen RTB Bor Doo (or ‘RTB Bor’) — a state-owned copper mining and smelting complex located in Bor, Serbia — in a $1.26 billion deal with the Government of Serbia. The agreement was part of the Government of Serbia’s broader efforts to sell-off indebted state-run companies to help spur growth and relieve pressure on the budget, as recommended by the International Monetary Fund (IMF). As part of the agreement, Zijin Mining Group promised to cover RTB Bor’s $200 million debt and keep 5,000 jobs at the mine. Out of the $1.26 billion, Zijin Mining Group said that $135 million would be invested in improving the environment while another $320 million in opening a new copper mine.   Then, in 2021, the Paris Branch of China Eximbank and Serbia Zijin Copper Doo Bor (塞尔维亚紫金铜业) — a special purpose vehicle and joint venture of Zijin Mining Group (63% ownership stake) and Rudarsko-Topioničarski Basen RTB Bor Doo (37% ownership stake) — signed a $68 million term loan facility agreement. The borrowing terms of the loan are unknown. However, it is known that the borrower was expected to use the loan proceeds for its working capital needs. Zijin Mining Group issued a corporate guarantee in support of this loan.
justification: Project involves working capital for a copper mining and smelting operation, which is a critical mineral for energy transition
evidence: Copper mining and smelting complex, working capital needs for mining operations

title: PLA donates 200,000 Sinopharm Covid-19 vaccine doses worth $3.6 million in May 2021
description: On May 19, 2021, the People's Liberation Army of China delivered 200,000 donated doses of Sinopharm Covid-19 vaccines to the Ministry of Defense of Serbia. Then, on May 27, 2021, the Chinese Government delivered another 500,000 donated doses of Sinopharm Covid-19 vaccines to the Government of Serbia.
staff_comments: 1. According to the UNICEF COVID-19 Vaccine Market Dashboard, the price of a single Sinopharm COVID-19 vaccine dose is $18 (https://www.oecd.org/officialdocuments/publicdisplaydocumentpdf/?cote=DCD/DAC/STAT(2022)33&docLanguage=En). As such, AidData has estimated the monetary value of the May 19, 2021 donation as $3.6 million.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
PLA donates 200,000 Sinopharm Covid-19 vaccine doses worth $3.6 million in May 2021

# Description
On May 19, 2021, the People's Liberation Army of China delivered 200,000 donated doses of Sinopharm Covid-19 vaccines to the Ministry of Defense of Serbia. Then, on May 27, 2021, the Chinese Government delivered another 500,000 donated doses of Sinopharm Covid-19 vaccines to the Government of Serbia.
justification: Project involves healthcare-related donation with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of Covid-19 vaccines, healthcare sector focus

title: Zijin Mining Group Ltd. donated EUR 1 million grant for the construction of a water supply system to the village of Metovnica (linked to Project ID#97652)
description: On July 8, 2021, Zijin Mining Group Ltd. signed an agreement with the Mayor of Bor, Serbia to provide a EUR 1 million (USD 1.19 million) grant for the construction of the water supply system to the nearby village of Metovnica. The system was expected to be completed in November 2021 and to serve 1,000 people once finished. As of September 2022, however, the connection of 400 households to the water supply system was reportedly still in progress.   Zijin Mining signed an additional agreement in September 2022 to cover the costs up to 25 cubic meters of water to these 400 households for five years (captured via Project ID#97652)
combined_text:
# Sector
WATER SUPPLY AND SANITATION

# Title
Zijin Mining Group Ltd. donated EUR 1 million grant for the construction of a water supply system to the village of Metovnica (linked to Project ID#97652)

# Description
On July 8, 2021, Zijin Mining Group Ltd. signed an agreement with the Mayor of Bor, Serbia to provide a EUR 1 million (USD 1.19 million) grant for the construction of the water supply system to the nearby village of Metovnica. The system was expected to be completed in November 2021 and to serve 1,000 people once finished. As of September 2022, however, the connection of 400 households to the water supply system was reportedly still in progress.   Zijin Mining signed an additional agreement in September 2022 to cover the costs up to 25 cubic meters of water to these 400 households for five years (captured via Project ID#97652)
justification: Project focuses on water supply infrastructure and social welfare, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Construction of water supply system, provision of free water to households, social development focus

title: Chinese Embassy in Seychelles donates living supplies worth SCR 100,000 to Seychelles Health Care Agency in May 2021
description: On May 14, 2021, the Chinese Embassy in Seychelles donated living supplies to the Seychelles Health Care Agency. The donation includes milk, juice, biscuits, coffee, and shampoo. The estimated value of the donation is SCR 100,000.  The donation was received and will be dispersed by the Seychelles Health Care Agency to healthcare workers in Seychelles.
